definition: road/path/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3]/principle/truth/morality/reason/skill/method/Dao (of Daoism)/to say/to speak/to talk/classifier for long thin things (rivers, cracks etc), barriers (walls, doors etc), questions (in an exam etc), commands, courses in a meal, steps in a process/(old) circuit (administrative division)

sentences.english: Thanks to demonization of Hinduism by British lootersand their evangelists.
sentences.chinese: 感謝英國掠奪者及其佈道者對印度教的妖魔化。

sentences.english: Christ preached that we should love each other.
sentences.chinese: 基督在佈道中說人們應該互愛。

sentences.english: What this sort of near-propaganda obscures, though, is the real benefits of open source software.
sentences.chinese: 這類近似佈道的論調遮蓋了開源軟件的真正好處。

sentences.english: The congregation was bored by the sermon.
sentences.chinese: 羣衆對佈道感到煩悶無趣。

sentences.english: The preacher was circuiting about the state.
sentences.chinese: 這位佈道者正在該州巡迴佈道。

sentences.english: The preacher was circuiting about the state.
sentences.chinese: 這位佈道者正在該州巡迴佈道。

sentences.english: But right now greens are the last people we need to be talking to.
sentences.chinese: 但現在的事實是，我們最不需要向環保主義者佈道。

sentences.english: In 2007, she became the Vice President of the ministry.
sentences.chinese: 在2007年成爲佈道團的副總幹事。

sentences.english: And the sermon was entitled "Living With Wisdom".
sentences.chinese: 佈道的話題是，智慧地生活。
我在向我的信徒們佈道。

sentences.english: Why Jesus gave His disciples those instructions when He sent them out to evangelize?
sentences.chinese: 耶穌差派門徒出去佈道時爲何對他們有這些吩咐？

sentences.english: Why? Because Peter does not want to take the message to Gentiles.
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼？因爲彼得不想向外邦人佈道。

sentences.english: The vicar gave an excellent sermon.
sentences.chinese: 教區牧師的佈道非常精彩。

sentences.english: We participated in mass evangelism meetings and saw people flow forward in droves.
sentences.chinese: 我們參與很多佈道大會，並看到許多人決志信主。

sentences.english: She dropped off during the sermon.
The priest preached a sermon on the need of charity.
sentences.chinese: 基督在佈道中說人們應該互敬互愛。

definition: to go to church on Sunday (of Christians)
to suffer a calamity/to suffer (e.g. under torture)/distress
